metadata.title: CVE-2023-52916 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:media: aspeed: Fix memory overwrite if timing is 1600x900When capturing 1600x900, system could crash when system memory usage istight.The way to reproduce this issue:1. Use 1600x900 to display on host2. Mount ISO through 'Virtual media' on OpenBMC's web3. Run script as below on host to do sha continuously  #!/bin/bash  while [ [1] ];  do	find /media -type f -printf '"%h/%f"\n' | xargs sha256sum  done4. Open KVM on OpenBMC's webThe size of macro block captured is 8x8. Therefore, we should make surethe height of src-buf is 8 aligned to fix this issue.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
